availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Remus Payne (Scott County, Kentucky, planter and shorthorn cattle breeder)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, planter and shorthorn cattle breeder. Kentucky native. Father of Charlotte Payne, Kitty Payne, John Payne, Henry Payne, Lewis Payne, and Robert Payne. Planter in Scott County in 1850. Shorthorn cattle breeder in Scott County. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in 1850 and twenty-nine in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 1, Eastport, p. 416A. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 1, Eastport, p. 573A. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 2, p. 15. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 2, p. 7-8. Allen, Lewis F., The American Herd-Book, Containing Pedigrees of Short-Horn Cattle, with Introductory Notes, Volume II (Buffalo, NY: Steam Press of Thomas & Lathrops, 1855), 467. Find A Grave, "Remus Payne (1811-1880)," Memorial #60902701, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60902701/remus-payne (accessed January 9, 2018).
